intro: Newbouldia laevis, commonly known as the white lily of the Nile, is a tropical plant native to Africa. It is a member of the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its large, showy white flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant has palmate leaves with five to seven lobes, and its stems are often covered in soft, hairy tissue. It thrives in wet, marshy environments and is often found near water bodies. Newbouldia laevis is also valued for its ornamental beauty and has cultural significance in some African communities.
